Search Results for

    Edit this page

    Class Json<T>

    Namespace
    AetherUtils.Core.Files
    Assembly
    AetherUtils.Core.dll
    Implements serializing and de-serializing generic object types to/from JSON files.
    public sealed class Json<T> where T : class

    Type Parameters

    T
    The type of object to serialize/deserialize.
    Inheritance
    object
    Json<T>
    Inherited Members
    object.Equals(object)
    object.Equals(object, object)
    object.GetHashCode()
    object.GetType()
    object.ReferenceEquals(object, object)
    object.ToString()
    Extension Methods
    TypeExtensions.CanSerializeJson<T>(T)
    TypeExtensions.CanSerializeXml<T>(T)
    TypeExtensions.SerializeJson<T>(T)
    TypeExtensions.SerializeXml<T>(T)

    Remarks

    T must support JSON serialization.

    Constructors

    Json()

    Create a new Json serializer with the default settings.
    public Json()

    Json(Formatting)

    Create a new Json serializer with the specified Newtonsoft.Json.Formatting.
    public Json(Formatting formatting)

    Parameters

    formatting Formatting
    The formatting to use for the serializer.

    Json(JsonSerializerSettings)

    Create a new Json serializer with the specified Newtonsoft.Json.JsonSerializerSettings.
    public Json(JsonSerializerSettings settings)

    Parameters

    settings JsonSerializerSettings
    The settings to use for the serializer.

    Exceptions

    ArgumentNullException
    If settings is null.

    Methods

    FromJson(string)

    Deserialize a Json string into a .NET object.
    public T? FromJson(string json)

    Parameters

    json string
    The Json string representing the .NET object.

    Returns

    T
    The .NET object of type T.

    Exceptions

    ArgumentException
    If json was null or empty.

    LoadJson(string)

    Deserialize and load a .NET object from a JSON file.
    public T? LoadJson(string filePath)

    Parameters

    filePath string
    The file to load.

    Returns

    T
    The T object, or null if the object could not be deserialized.

    Exceptions

    ArgumentException
    If filePath was null or empty.
    FileNotFoundException
    If the filePath did not exist.

    SaveJson(string, T)

    Serialize a .NET object, T, to a JSON string and save to a file.

    If the file already exists, it is overwritten.

    public bool SaveJson(string filePath, T obj)

    Parameters

    filePath string
    The file to save.
    obj T
    The .NET object to serialize and save.

    Returns

    bool
    true if the object was serialized and the file was saved; false otherwise.

    Exceptions

    ArgumentException
    If the filePath was null or empty.

    ToJson(T)

    Serialize a .NET object, T, to a JSON string.
    public string ToJson(T obj)

    Parameters

    obj T
    The .NET object to serialize.

    Returns

    string
    A Json string representing the .NET object.

    Exceptions

    ArgumentNullException
    If obj was null.
